title: 特定のメールアカウントだけ受信トレイが表示されない(POP)
creator: NNC
content:
本日突然、ある特定のアカウントのみ受信トレイにメールが表示されなくなりました。 （送信済みトレイの履歴は表示されています。）

複数メールアカウントを管理していますが、別のメールアカウントの方は問題なく表示され、受信できる状態です。

プロパティを開くと表示される「場所」の項目も、空欄になっていて表示されません。 念のため「フォルダの修復」や「最適化」も試みましたが、改善しませんでした。

対処法をご教示いただけますと幸いです。

title: Geen ontvangst van verificatiecode
creator: wouter.gerretsen
content:
Hallo. MyUplink is een app van de NIBE warmtepompleverancier. Als je hierop inlogt wordt er een verificatiecode naar het e-mail adres verstuurd waarmee je ook inlogt. Helaas ontvang ik geen verificatiecode. De ontvanger beweert dat deze wel correct wordt verzonden; hieronder het antwoord van NIBE:

'Wat betreft myUplink: de IT afdeling van ons hoofdkantoor bevestigt dat e-mails correct worden verzonden en dat deze, voor zover uit het communicatieverkeer blijkt, ook worden ontvangen. Gezien er geen fouten geconstateerd worden kunnen zij helaas hierin geen verdere ondersteuning bieden dan enkel te wijzen naar uw Internet Service Provider. Misschien kunt u bij hen controleren of mails geblokt worden van myUplink'

Help alstublieft. Vriendelijke groet Wout Gerretsen
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:140.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/140.0

title: Server log in password
creator: 2dave
content: I am using Thunderbird ESR 115.18.0 (64 bit) Supernova? on Windows 7 Pro. Just recently one of my email addresses doesn't work. When I start TB all the email servers used to be checked automatically and display new messages in the correct individual inboxes. Now two of them don't work. A box comes up saying something has failed and I am asked to enter a new password or Retry. Nothing works. I have no idea what password it is referring to. I have tried passwords related to the router supplied by my ISP and any correspondence about my account with them. After reading dozens of FAQs and posts in the communitiy I am more confused than ever. Why should it suddenly forget a critical password? Nothing has changed apart from maybe a TB update. Thankfully the mail addresses affected are not ones I use often, but they are the ones assigned by my ISP and are used for voicemail alerts, etc. I have considered reinstalling Thunderbird but don't know how to do it without putting my two most important addresses at risk, and with no guaratee it would solve the missing password problem anyway. Can you shed any light?
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/109.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 OPR/95.0.0.0;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/protect-your-thunderbird-passwords-primary-password"]

title: Issue with count of unread emails not being correct on taskbar/tray icons since upgrading to 139.0.2
creator: chrisw4
content:
I'm running Windows 10 and recently switched from the ESR Channel version (128.11.1) to the Release Channel version (139.0.2) and, since then, have started having a problem where the unread email count displayed on the system tray icon and also the count on the Taskbar icon are no longer correct. Most incoming, unread emails aren't counted. This feature has always worked correctly for me previously, ever since I first installed Thunderbird several years ago. When I go into Thunderbird, the count of unread emails in whatever folder they're in is still correct, the problem is just with the counts on the taskbar and tray icons.

I'm not 100% sure, but I *think* it might be the case that emails which end up in the default "Inbox" folder are added to the counts, but those which are automatically allocated on arrival to other folders on the basis of filter rules aren't being added to the counts displayed on the icons. I have searched for others reporting the same issue and haven't been able to find anything, so it seems unlikely that it's a bug. I'd greatly appreciate any help in resolving this issue please.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:140.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/140.0

title: Can't send email due to Add Security Exception
creator: mindonwater
content:
Add Security Exception? I can't send any outgoing email messages. I now get a warning alert after hitting Send entitled "Add Security Exception". It says further, "You are about to override how Thunderbird identifies this site." And, "Legitimate banks, stores and other public sites will not ask you to do this." My email provider is Earthlink and the alert identifies the server location as, "smtpauth.earthlink.net:587" and says, "This site attempts to identify itself with invalid information. Unknown Identity. The certificate is not trusted because it hasn't been verified as issued by a trusted authority using a secure signature."

That only available options are, "Confirm Security Exception" and "Cancel". Selection of either option brings up the same next alert, "Send Message Error", "Sending of the message failed. Peer's Certificate issuer isn't recognized. The configuration related to smtpauth.earthlink.net must be corrected."

I didn't intentionally change any settings or receive any notification from Earthlink to that effect, so I don't know why any of these protocols would have changed. I can view the smtpauth.earthlink.net certificate but I don't know how to copy it or attach it for diagnostic purposes. Can anyone provide insight regarding what is going on here and how to resolve it? Any solutions will be greatest appreciated.
metadata: ;solver_id:1820328;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:139.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/139.0;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/use-troubleshooting-information-page-fix-firefox"]
